metadata.feature_description: Tests the extension point for future account settings features

steps.action: Navigate to PersonaBar and access the Accounts section
steps.actual: Accounts panel (Users view) loaded successfully with user list displayed

steps.action: Search DOM for 'tabs-extensions' element using getElementById, querySelector, and text search
steps.expected: Element with id 'tabs-extensions' should exist in the DOM
steps.actual: Element 'tabs-extensions' was NOT found in the DOM by any search method (byId: false, byQuery: false, byContains: false)

issues: The 'tabs-extensions' div container does not exist in the current PersonaBar Accounts UI DOM

steps.action: Search DOM for elements with 'personabar-extensions' CSS class using getElementsByClassName and querySelector
steps.actual: No elements with class 'personabar-extensions' were found (byClass: 0, byQuery: false, byContains: false)

issues: The 'personabar-extensions' CSS class is not applied to any element in the current PersonaBar Accounts UI

observations: The Accounts module (Evoq.Accounts) loads successfully and displays the Users panel with user management functionality
The source code repository (Dnn.AdminExperience.Evoq.Basic) appears to be empty or inaccessible, preventing code-level verification of the extension infrastructure

The feature description references code files (admin/personaBar/AccountSettings.html, Components/AccountSettingsController.cs) that suggest placeholder infrastructure exists in the codebase, but these elements are not rendered in the current UI

Two suggested test scenarios ('Test Components controller class exists for future implementation' and 'Verify extension point can be targeted by other modules') are code-level tests that cannot be verified through UI testing without source code access
The extension placeholder infrastructure may be code-only infrastructure that is not visually represented in the DOM until extensions are actually registered to use it
